body_text:
This adds a new preference app.shield.optoutstudies.enabled that will track whether a user has opted-out of participating in opt-out Shield studies. A checkbox is injected into about:preferences (only the new organization) that controls the pref. See bug 1377192 for the spec.
This also fixes our preferences so that they're set as default values immediately on startup instead of as user-set values. Existing users will still have user-set values, and we should follow up soon with a migration of some kind to get them on default values if possible. But switching now will help existing users, and also affect the new preference being added by this PR, so it's worth doing.
I cleared shipping this as en-US only with flod a few weeks ago, as long as we do not display the checkbox to users in non en-* locales. Accordingly, we will not run any studies outside of those locales until we hook up translation, so that users can properly opt-out of feature studies.
I filed #937 separately to actually use this preference in the opt-out-study and preference-experiment actions.

title: Add global opt-out study preference to add-on
body:
This adds a new preference `app.shield.optoutstudies.enabled` that will track whether a user has opted-out of participating in opt-out Shield studies. A checkbox is injected into about:preferences (only the new organization) that controls the pref. See [bug 1377192](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1377192) for the spec.

This also fixes our preferences so that they're set as default values immediately on startup instead of as user-set values. Existing users will still have user-set values, and we should follow up soon with a migration of some kind to get them on default values if possible. But switching now will help existing users, and also affect the new preference being added by this PR, so it's worth doing.

I cleared shipping this as en-US only with flod a few weeks ago, as long as we do not display the checkbox to users in non en-* locales. Accordingly, we will not run any studies outside of those locales until we hook up translation, so that users can properly opt-out of feature studies.

I filed #937 separately to actually use this preference in the `opt-out-study` and `preference-experiment` actions.
